{"step_by_step_thinking": "An oral hypoglycemic agent is a medication that is taken orally to lower blood sugar levels in individuals with diabetes. Warfarin is not an oral hypoglycemic agent, it is an anticoagulant medication used to prevent blood clots. Insulin is not an oral medication, it is a hormone that is usually injected to regulate blood sugar levels. Glibeneclamide is an oral hypoglycemic agent, it belongs to the sulfonylurea class of medications and helps to stimulate insulin release from the pancreas. Gluengon is not a known medication, so it is not an oral hypoglycemic agent.", "answer_choice": "C. Glibeneclamide"}
